verbose_text: miR-92a has been reported to be highly enriched in chondrogenic progenitors, and it has been found that its inactivation stabilizes the mRNA expression of the bone morphogenetic protein (BMP) antagonist gene, noggin3, leading to the repression of BMP signaling and the abnormal function of chondrogenic progenitors, which results in the unsustainable survival of chondrogenic progenitors.
evidence: expression of the bone morphogenetic protein
